title: Saturn square Venus
summary: A tension between values, pleasure, and responsibility. What feels desirable may be constrained by time, resources, or commitments, prompting a reassessment of priorities. The task is to refine value without collapsing into scarcity thinking.

meaning.headline: Not everything you want is available on your current timeline.

frames.text: Saturn-Venus squares surface friction between desire and duty, asking for honest evaluation of what's worth sustaining.
This aspect doesn't remove value-it tests whether value is being supported by structure.
Pleasure may feel delayed or conditional when resources are tight or standards are high.
Discomfort often points to misalignment between wants and realistic capacity.
This means deprivation, rejection, or lack of love.

frictions: Scarcity thinking around time, money, or affection
Withholding affection or enjoyment as self-control
Judging desires as impractical or immature
opportunities: Clarifying which values are worth long-term investment
Building structures that support sustainable pleasure
Strengthening boundaries around time and energy

do: Assess whether your current commitments support what you value.
Name the constraint clearly-time, money, energy, or obligation.
Make deliberate choices about what to delay versus what to sustain.
Build structure around pleasure rather than eliminating it.
Practice patience without framing desire as weakness.
avoid: Interpreting limits as proof of unworthiness
Withholding enjoyment as a form of discipline
Assuming value must be earned through deprivation

reusable_lines.text: Constraint doesn't erase value-it asks how you support it.

allowed_framing: Contextual framing: 'if resources or time feel tight...'

sources: Saturn-Venus square as value/structure tension archetype
